text:
Hello everyone,
I am working on developing a blog that should have a structure similar to HubSpot's marketing blog, for example: <https://blog.HubSpot.com/marketing|HubSpot Marketing Blog>.
One thing I find puzzling is that HubSpot blogs account for the first pagination page being the same as the listing page. This is not something I want, and HubSpot's own blog doesn't operate this way either. The first page on their blog is a completely custom listing page that doesn't care how many blog posts there are and doesn't account for pagination. Plus, at the bottom, you have the option to go to page 1 where there's pagination and a simpler template. This is precisely what I'm aiming for.
However, I haven't found any straightforward and clean variables to use to achieve this. HubSpot doesn't seem to allow differentiation between the blog listing and pagination pages, and for some reason, I also have a default page 0, which I have no idea what it's for.
The only way I can think of replicating HubSpot's behavior is by using an 'if' statement on the blog listing HTML page and matching it with the exact path of the listingâ€”so for example, 'website/blog'. This way, it would display what I want without counting the listing page as page 1. I'm not fond of this solution, and I'm certain there's a better way. Yet when I look at HubSpot's blog, it seems like they've done just that; they also have an unused page 0: <https://blog.HubSpot.com/marketing/page/0|HubSpot Marketing Blog Page 0>, which is identical to page 1.
Is there a cleaner way to accomplish this?
Any ideas <@U01QVR44MEY> ?, you are the best
good evening, someone who has integrated chatflow in nodejs?

Hello All!
I am facing an invalid date format issue when I create and update contact records using API (<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/contact/batch/>").
Please check the screenshot <https://capture.dropbox.com/6b52xWZyWPaI9hdI> and let me correct the format allowed in HubSpot using  API (<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/contact/batch/>").
